testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: -Configure AP1 Enable tunnel1 between AP1 and Gateway1 Enable tunnel2 between AP1 and Gateway2 Enable 1 dhcp server（mgt0.1） Mgt0.1 vlan10 IPaddr 10.1.10.1 gateway 10.1.10.1 Laptop1 connect to Mgt0.1 IPaddr 10.1.10.2 (wifi)
Test Procedure: 1) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 2) Configure network firewall rule "network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to vpn action permit logging on" "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on" 3) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 4) Delete network firewall config on AP1 "no network-firewall" 5) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 6) Configure network firewall rule on AP1 "network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to vpn action deny logging on" "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on" 7) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3 8) Delete network firewall config on AP1 "no network-firewall" 9) Laptop1 ping Laptop2 and Laptop3

step.desc: config BR with WAN interface, nat enable
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${cvg1.cvg.wan.netmask}"

step.desc: config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${cvg1.cvg.wan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: Set interface eth0 to wan mode,eth1/eth2 to access mode and enable mac-learning
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
config BR as l3 VPN client
config CVG1 act as l3 VPN server
config CVG2 act as l3 VPN server
Configure network firewall rule “network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to vpn action permit logging on” “network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on”
step.telnet: -v "network-firewall name 1001 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac} to vpn action permit logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on" -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log all"

step.log-match: -p "ACCEPT PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
-p "ACCEPT PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg2.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: Configure network firewall rule on AP1 “network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to vpn action deny logging on” “network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on”
step.telnet: -v "clear log all" -v "network-firewall name 1001 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac} to vpn action deny logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging on"

step.log-match: -p "DROP PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
-p "(?i)DROP PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg2.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
